definition: Thank heavens!/Thank goodness that's worked out so well!
surname Xie
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
day/sky/heaven
surname Xie
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: Thankfully, there is no sign of this occurring yet.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，現在還沒有發生這種情況的跡象。

sentences.english: Thank God I'm not being sent to the principal's office!
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，我不會被送到校長室去了。

sentences.english: I am thankful to have broken a spell.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，我已經打破了一個緊箍咒。

sentences.english: Thank God, that I stand so near and can at least see all the splendour.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，我靠得這麼近，至少能夠欣賞到她們的美。

sentences.english: Those dark forces are thankfully a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地這些暗黑勢力成了一個遙遠的回憶。

sentences.english: Thank God. How much do you want?
sentences.chinese: 那就謝天謝地了，你想要多少呢？

sentences.english: Thank god. I was so worried.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，我都快急死了。

sentences.english: And then, mercifully, they all vanished.
sentences.chinese: 接着，謝天謝地，他們全體消失了。

sentences.english: Thank God he seems to be out of the woods now!
sentences.chinese: 他似乎渡過了危險期，真是謝天謝地。

sentences.english: Thank goodness, it is still a bill worth passing.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，好歹這是個值得通過的法案。

sentences.english: But, thank God, he is healthy.
sentences.chinese: 但是，謝天謝地，他很健康。

sentences.english: And we won't leave much of a trace, either. Thank God for that.
sentences.chinese: 而且，謝天謝地，我們留不下什麼痕跡。

sentences.english: Thank goodness, I finally went through the strait with his aids.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，最後，在他的幫助下，我熬了過來。

sentences.english: Thank God, finally had struggled to live with it through the difficult period.
sentences.chinese: 謝天謝地，總算熬過了度日如年的困難期。

definition: Good Friday
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
to force someone to do something
to feel disheartened
unlucky
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
shadow
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
hard to remember
to digress/to stray from the subject
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
